decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a strong emphasis on disruption and versatility. It utilizes a mix of efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Path to Exile, along with hand disruption in the form of Thoughtseize. Creatures like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino provide a quick clock for the opponent while cards like Dark Confidant and Courser of Kruphix help maintain card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multiple color requirements and includes utility lands like Gavony Township and Vault of the Archangel.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells while ramping up mana with Search for Tomorrow and Farseek. The ultimate goal is to cast Scapeshift to find multiple copies of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and enough Mountains to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also utilizes Snapcaster Mage to reuse key spells and can generate additional value from its lands with the Valakut triggers. By controlling the game and ramping up mana, this deck aims to quickly close out games with a massive burst of damage.

This deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent. The main strategy is to deploy threats like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Tasigur, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay. Lingering Souls provides additional value by creating flying blockers and Noble Hierarch helps to accelerate the mana base. Liliana of the Veil is used as a versatile planeswalker that can control the board and disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption.

The main concept of this deck focuses on utilizing graveyard recursion and self-mill mechanics to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and trigger powerful graveyard-based effects. The goal is to efficiently fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Vengevine, which can then be recurred with cards like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive board presence. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Murderous Cut to control the board and protect the combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Splinter Twin combo by using Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to untap a permanent and create an infinite number of hasty creature tokens. The deck includes various control elements like Remand and Cryptic Command to protect the combo pieces, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Grim Lavamancer to deal with threats. With the help of card draw and selection spells like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to efficiently find the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize a mix of creatures, burn spells, and counterspells to maintain board control while applying pressure to the opponent. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats such as Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, supported by cheap interaction like Lightning Bolt and Mana Leak. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by recycling spells from the graveyard. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and efficiency, aiming to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan in order to search for key lands such as Vesuva and Sunhome, Fortress of the Legion. The deck also includes cards like Hive Mind and Pact of Negation to disrupt opponents and protect the combo. With the use of cards like Explore and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, the deck can quickly assemble the necessary pieces to win the game through a powerful titan attack, while also having options for additional utility lands and protection.

The main concept of this deck revolves around assembling UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a massive amount of mana. This allows for the quick deployment of powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Wurmcoil Engine while controlling the board with cards like Pyroclasm and Oblivion Stone. The deck also includes card filtering and tutoring to help find key pieces and maintain consistency. Ultimately, the objective is to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats and powerful control elements.

The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to quickly play efficient creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with removal and discard spells. By utilizing powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Wilt-Leaf Liege, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Path to Exile, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain board control throughout the game. Cards like Lingering Souls and Voice of Resurgence provide additional value and resilience, while cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise help accelerate the deck's mana base for faster plays.

This deck is meant to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. The key strategy involves playing low-cost creatures and burn spells to chip away at the opponent's life total while also preventing them from gaining life or stabilizing. The spells in the deck are designed to deal direct damage to the opponent's creatures or directly to their life total. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure and close out games swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a fast and consistent storm count to cast a lethal Grapeshot. Utilizing cards like Pyromancer Ascension, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual, the deck aims to chain together spells to build up a high storm count and finish off the opponent with a massive Grapeshot. The deck also includes card draw and filtering spells like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to help dig for combo pieces and ensure a smooth and efficient storm sequence. Additionally, cards like Past in Flames and Gitaxian Probe provide additional utility and flexibility for the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost artifact creatures and leveraging them with powerful artifact cards like Cranial Plating and Etched Champion. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while also having the ability to protect them with cards like Welding Jar and Ensoul Artifact. The deck also has a strong mana base with cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ensure a consistent flow of mana. Additionally, the combination of creature buffs and evasion abilities from cards like Blinkmoth Nexus and Inkmoth Nexus helps to close out games quickly.

The focus of this deck is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo as quickly as possible by utilizing cards like Summer Bloom, Amulet of Vigor, and Primeval Titan to generate a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also incorporates cards like Hive Mind and Pact of Negation to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently ramping up mana production and deploying threats, the deck aims to quickly close out games and win through a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this Merfolk deck is to quickly build up a board of aggressive Merfolk creatures, while using disruptive spells like Spreading Seas and Tidebinder Mage to control the opponent's resources. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play at instant speed, while cards like Master of Waves and Lord of Atlantis provide buffs and token generation to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of countermagic like Kira, Great Glass-Spinner and disruption with Relic of Progenitus help to protect and disrupt the opponent's game plan, making it a versatile and powerful aggro deck in Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with cheap and efficient artifact creatures, backed up by cards that provide additional damage or card advantage. Using cards like Steel Overseer and Cranial Plating to pump up the creatures, along with the ability to quickly refill your hand with Thoughtcast, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The deck also has options for protection and evasion in cards like Welding Jar and Inkmoth Nexus to ensure its creatures stay on the board and deal damage effectively.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, removal spells such as Path to Exile and Murderous Cut, and counterspells like Remand and Mana Leak. It also generates value by utilizing graveyard interaction with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Lingering Souls. The deck can control the board with creatures like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Blade Splicer, while also providing additional value with cards like Monastery Mentor and Restoration Angel to close out the game.
